structure.unit: Real And Personal Property And Domestic Relations
Descent And Distribution, Wills, Estates Of Deceased Persons And Absentees, Guardianship, Conservatorship And Trusts

law.catch_line: Property Distributable Upon Dissolution Or Liquidation; Presumption Of Abandonment
law.text: All property distributable in the course of a voluntary or involuntary dissolution or liquidation of a person that remains unclaimed by the person entitled thereto, within one year after the date of final distribution or liquidation, shall be presumed abandoned. This section shall apply to all tangible personal property located in the commonwealth and subject to the provisions of section one A to all intangible personal property.
